The Copywriter is an integral sense-making designer who crafts copy or content for users when using our digital product. He/she advocates the importance of humanizing digital products through words, that words are nuanced, and that without words, our products would be faceless shapes with no mood nor tone of voice. He/she ensures users have the most delightful experience possible with the words he/she uses to guide their experience through the journey on our site and app.

A problem solver, the Copywriter has special knack for digital user interface (UI) copy and content, obsession with clarity, concern for space, interest in the visual placement of the information, and a sufficient understanding of how websites and apps are built. The latter helps him/her anticipate the copy that is needed, think up of all the possible scenarios a user may embark on and make that whole experience make sense.

The Copywriter conducts design research by delivering research context and requirements based on research objectives, and synthesize data to draw conclusions that drive content (copy and visual) effectiveness.

In addition, he/she demonstrates strong interpersonal, prioritization, and stakeholder management skills in collaborating with product team, engineers, interaction designers, visual designers and various other roles. Not only that he/she is collaborative, the Copywriter brings empathy to the foreground of our efforts by understanding how a user is feeling and what their needs are while interacting with our products.

To obtain optimal product fit and quality, he/she is able to work on multiple tasks concurrently and deliver on expectations within deadlines, with high level of changes and iterations required. In addition, he/she demonstrates stakeholder management skills in partnering with internal stakeholders to develop high quality creative solutions that meet overall business objectives and goals.

Craft & implement UI copy and content to deliver design output

Clarify the assigned design project scope, including its goals, requirements, and expectations
Explore possible scenarios a user may embark on to ensure the whole experience make sense
Identify good copy that shapes interactions between user and product by seeking understanding of the entire product design and development process by collaborating with fellow designers and stakeholders
Create UI copy featured on the product that guides the user when navigating their way around our digital products, services, and functions within the platform to help them complete the task at hand
Test designed copy solution with solution validation activity that meets with design spec and ready to implement in the intended platform when necessary
Adhere to style guides in line with the brand voice and personality
Liaise with engineers during copy implementation to ensure the designed copy is completed and implemented accurately
Deliver projects in parallel with managing stakeholder engagement
Consult business stakeholders to clarify requirements to ensure context, angle and user
scenario accuracy, when needed

Develop copy strategy for projects

Champion copy as an integral part of the design process from the very start and not to be treated as an afterthought by promoting the importance of language and not letting bad copy let the product down
